section.title: Tutorial dialogue
section.p: (I just write here some ofmy considerations, please rewrite where needed) The system gives feedback and makes suggestions on the basis of errors produced by the user. The language of the feedback? If we have feedback only in S치mi, then it must be really simple (avoid grammatical terms). It is not difficult to do different versions of feedback for different languages, since the sentences that are used in feedback are static.

The tutorial dialogue can be implemented as part of the general dialogue as: -What did you buy? - I buy bread. - Did you mean: You bought bread? (perhaps alternatives) - Yes ... Or the tutorial dialogue can be separate from the actual dialogue, it can be a pop-up window or something more pleasant: a side bar that contains the feedback, or..

Are there different levels in the feedback? First, "There is a wrong form in the sentence the word "___" , Let's try again" If the form is wrong again, then provide the grammatical form where the word should be in "The correct form is nominative", if the user fails then give the correct alternatives "Perhaps you meant __ or __?".
How the user responds to the feedback? Does she merely choose from the list or is she required to write the sentence again?

The form of the feedback is created beforehand. The feedback is different in different situations. We probably want to "teach" the user, give grammatical information, reasons why the form she used is wrong, etc. The types of feedback have to be thought carefully.
